document_data.caption: A common mask.
document_data.name: Mask
document_data.mainbody: '''Masks''' were decorative clothing in the Realms used to cover one's face.
document_data.Description: Masks came with a variety of options, but the most common version covered the wearer's eyes.

Varieties.Death mask (object)|Death mask: otherwise known as a '''funerary mask''', were a type of mask made to be laid upon the face of a deceased individual before burial rites. Many were made from fine metals, with [[gold]] bearded visages made for nobles typically valuing at around 44 gold pieces.
Varieties.Domino mask: A form of simple black mask that was commonly used by [[rogue]]s.

document_data.Significance:
Masks were sometimes worn on special occasions in the Realms, such as holidays. On [[Lliira's Night]], it was common to see people wear star-shaped masks, while on [[Liar's Night]] people were encouraged to don all manner of masks. Though the most commonly worn masks on that holiday were those designed to depict the symbol of the god known as [[Mask]] and the mirror masks of the [[Leiran]] clergy.

Beyond their literal use, a number of organizations in the Realms featured masks as part of their symbol, such as the [[Night Masks]], and the [[Church of Vhaeraun]].

Notable Users.Businesses: * The [[Moonstone Mask]], a renowned festhall in [[Neverwinter]], was so named for having all members of its staff wear glowing masks that were trimmed with [[moonstone]]s.
Notable Users.Individuals: * [[Azaka Stormfang]], wielder of the ''mask of the beast''.<ref>
Notable Users.Organizations:
* The members of the Night Masks typically wore domino masks.
* The [[Rogues of Tilverton]] all wore black silk face-masks that they kept stored in hidden compartments in [[Grimwald's Revenge]].<ref>
Notable Users.Races & Sentient Creatures: * All [[batiri]] typically wore an oversized wooden war mask. Each mask was decorated and painted by its owner, designing them to intimidate their enemies. Besides being an article of clothing, these masks served the same purpose as coats of arms.<ref>
Notable Users.Religions:
* The main altar in a [[Maskarran]] temple often had mask of [[silk]] floating above it.
* The priestly raiments of the [[Church of Leira]] included silvery, mirror-like masks.
